body_html:
Also I am not sure why we need the const keword for the output_port_id parm in the .cc file, it is NOT in the header file declaration. The int parm is passed-by-value anyway, no!?

void MutableGraphView::ReplaceInput(const NodeDef& old_input,
                                    const NodeDef& new_input,
                                    const int output_port_id)  // why const here?
body_text:
Also I am not sure why we need the const keword for the output_port_id parm in the .cc file, it is NOT in the header file declaration.  The int parm is passed-by-value anyway, no!?
void MutableGraphView::ReplaceInput(const NodeDef& old_input,
                                    const NodeDef& new_input,
                                    const int output_port_id)  // why const here?
body:
Also I am not sure why we need the `const` keword for the `output_port_id` parm in the .cc file, it is NOT in the header file declaration.  The `int` parm is passed-by-value anyway, no!?

```c++
void MutableGraphView::ReplaceInput(const NodeDef& old_input,
                                    const NodeDef& new_input,
                                    const int output_port_id)  // why const here?
```
